articleinfo.title: EPICS Lakeshore 340 Support Module User Guide

sect2.title: IO Status shows TIMEOUT - Device not responding
sect2.para: If the Interaface Control is in the On state but the device does not respond to the regular reading of the filter position then the interface will display the value TIMEOUT in the IO Status field. The interface still behaves as normal but that the change int the desired filter position will not cause an actual change in position. The Filter field will show the value that was last read successfully.

listitem.para: Check that the device is powered on and is controllable by the front panel button
Check that the serial cable is connected to the device.
Try powering the device on and off.

sect2.title: STB or ESR do not show 0
sect2.para: STB is the Status Byte read from the device
32 decimal ; 20 Hex / bit5 ; indicate an error condition
ESR is the value of the Event Status Register read when the STB last read 0
80 - The 74041 has been power on reset since last read
20 - The 74041 has received an illegal command
10 - The 74041 had a problem with the filter wheel
Press the reset button is STB is now 0 to clear the latched value of the ESR

sect2.title: Filter is shown as unkown when Interface Control is On
sect2.para: No valid filter erading has yet been made of the device

listitem.para: Physically check that the filter wheel is connected to the controller.
